csse2002.security

Class TwoCoinChannel

  • java.lang.Object
    • csse2002.security.TwoCoinChannel

  • public class TwoCoinChannel
extends java.lang.Object
    Informants are privy to the value of a Boolean-valued secret. An informant may reveal some information about the secret to a spy using a two-coin channel.

    Having chosen biased two coins, the first, coin1, with heads-bias c1 and the second, coin2, with heads-bias c2, the informant reveals the bias of both coin1 and coin2 to the spy. Then, in private, the informant flips coin1 if the secret is true, and coin2 if the secret is false, and reveals the outcome of the coin flip to the spy (but not which coin has been flipped).

    Before the spy learns information from the informant she knows the likelihood that the secret is true, and the likelihood that it is false.

    After the informant has revealed to the spy the outcome of the coin flip, the spy can update her knowledge of the distribution of the secret, given the outcome of the coin flip.

    The immutable class TwoCoinChannel can be used to keep track of the coins used by an informant, and to calculate, given a spy's a priori knowledge of the secret (i.e. the initial distribution of the secret):

    (a) The likelihood that the outcome of the coin flip will be heads or tails, and

    (b) The a posteriori distribution of the secret given the outcome is heads (or tails). (i.e. the likelihood that the secret is true or false given that the outcome is heads (or tails)).

    For example, if coin1 has heads-bias 3/4 and coin2 has head-bias 1/4 and the spy initially knows that the secret is true with probability 1/2 and false with probability 1/2, then:
    1. The probability that the outcome of the private-coin-flip will be heads is: 1/2*3/4 + 1/2*1/4 = 1/2
    2. The probability that the outcome of the private-coin-flip will be tails is: 1/2*1/4 + 1/2*3/4 = 1/2
    3. The probability that the secret is true given that the outcome is heads is: 1/2*3/4 divided by 1/2 = 3/4
    4. The probability that the secret is true given that the outcome is tails is: 1/2*1/4 divided by 1/2 = 1/4

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TwoCoinChannel(BigFraction c1, BigFraction c2)
      Creates a new channel with a coin with heads-bias c1 for secret true and c2 for secret false.

      Determines whether this class is internally consistent.
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
      Returns true iff o is a TwoCoinChannel with the same coin bias as this for secret true, and the same coin bias as this for secret false.
      BigFraction getCoinBias(boolean s)
      Returns the bias (towards heads) of the coin that will be flipped if the secret has value s.
      int hashCode() 
      BigFraction outcomeProbability(BigFraction aPriori, boolean outcome)
      Returns the probability that the outcome of the private coin flip will be (outcome? heads: tails) given that the secret is initially known to be true with probability aPriori (and false with the complement of aPriori).
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns the String: "(C1, C2)" where C1 is the heads-bias of the coin for secret true, and C2 is the heads-bias of the coin for secret false.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TwoCoinChannel

        public TwoCoinChannel(BigFraction c1,
              BigFraction c2)
        Creates a new channel with a coin with heads-bias c1 for secret true and c2 for secret false.
        Parameters:
        c1 - The bias of the first coin towards outcome heads.
        c2 - The bias of the second coin towards outcome heads.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If either c1 or c2 is null
        InvalidProbabilityException - If c1 or c2 are not probabilities.

    • Method Detail

      • outcomeProbability

        public BigFraction outcomeProbability(BigFraction aPriori,
                             boolean outcome)
        Returns the probability that the outcome of the private coin flip will be (outcome? heads: tails) given that the secret is initially known to be true with probability aPriori (and false with the complement of aPriori).
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If aPriori is null.
        InvalidProbabilityException - If aPriori is not a probability.

      • aPosteriori

        public BigFraction aPosteriori(BigFraction aPriori,
                      boolean outcome)
        Given that the secret is initially known to be true with probability aPriori (and false with the remaining probability), this method returns:

        1. BigFraction.ZERO, if the probability of the outcome (outcome? heads: tails) is zero, and
        2. the probability that the secret is true, given that the outcome of the private coin flip is (outcome? heads: tails), otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If aPriori is null.
        InvalidProbabilityException - If aPriori is not a probability.

      • getCoinBias

        public BigFraction getCoinBias(boolean s)
        Returns the bias (towards heads) of the coin that will be flipped if the secret has value s.
        Parameters:
        s - The secret for which the coin bias will be returned.
        Returns:
        The bias (towards heads) of the coin that will be flipped if the secret has value s.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns the String: "(C1, C2)" where C1 is the heads-bias of the coin for secret true, and C2 is the heads-bias of the coin for secret false. (The biases are represented using the toString-representation of BigFraction.)
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Returns true iff o is a TwoCoinChannel with the same coin bias as this for secret true, and the same coin bias as this for secret false. Two coin biases are considered to be the same if they represent the same rational value.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

        Overrides:

        Determines whether this class is internally consistent.

        true if this class is internally consistent, and false otherwise
